description: Questions about the value and benefits of solving the problem
methodology_guidance: Let the customer sell themselves on the solution. They should talk 70%+ here.

good_examples.question: If you could eliminate those production delays, what would that mean for your quarterly targets?
good_examples.why_good: Lets customer articulate value in their own terms

good_examples.question: How would it help if your team could access data from any location securely?
good_examples.why_good: Paints positive picture, invites customer to elaborate

good_examples.question: What would change for your team if this problem was solved?
good_examples.why_good: Open-ended, lets customer paint the vision

good_examples.question: If we could reduce that downtime by 90%, what would you do with those recovered hours?
How would solving this impact your position with the board?

bad_examples.question: Wouldn't it be great if this was fixed?
Don't you want to solve this problem?
Our solution would save you money - that's good, right?
bad_examples.why_bad: Telling instead of asking, premature pitch
